div.ab: (29 September–24 December)

row.cell: ye fortune quitt rent

div.ab: The Mermaid on Bread Street, in the City of London , was a well-known tavern of its day, and on 18 September 1618 Alleyn dined there with five members of the company playing at the Fortune playhouse, plus Mr Edmonds, perhaps the John Edmonds who was a member of the Queen’s company at her death in 1619 (William Young, The History of Dulwich College, part 2 (London, 1889), 104). Members of the Fortune company often dined with Edward Alleyn at Dulwich.
Alleyn evidently visited his lawyers at Gray's Inn and then either at the Middle or Inner Temple.

div.ab: William Borne alias Bird was one of the players and sharers of the Fortune. Henslowe's Diary shows Borne frequently borrowed money from him. Mr Joas was one of Alleyn 's tenants (see entry for 16 July 1620).

div.ab: (29 September–24 December)

Richard Gunnell, William Cartwright, William Parr, and Richard Price were all the king of Bohemia's men (previously known as the Palatine's or Palsgrave servants until Frederic, Elector Palatine, was elected king in 1619), then acting at the Fortune. Gunnell and Parr were sharers in the Fortune from 20 May 1622. Cartwright was a sharer from 31 October 1618 (DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Groups 56 and 59), and dined with Alleyn on various occasions between 22 March 1616/17 and 18 August 1622.

Edward Alleyn's deed of uses of 24 April 1620 granted his lands, including the Fortune, to the College, although he retained a life interest in the revenues (DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Groups 586 and 587). Complementary to the deed are the letters patent (DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Group 581). See also the entries for 3, 15, 16, 23, 26, and 31 May and 28 June 1620.
The fine is now DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Group 589.

head.title: Diary and Account Book of Edward Alleyn

row.cell: 15 ☉ ☉: the astronomical symbol for Sunday
borne: massey: Cartwright: gunnell: grace: Hunt dind Here & my Lewesham baly

div.ab: William Borne, Charles Massey, William Cartwright, Richard Gunnell, and Frank Grace were all members of the Fortune company. A Thomas Hunte was one of the company who signed a bond with Philip Henslowe to perform 'certen articles' of the same date, 29 August 1611, but his name does not appear on the lease of 31 October 1618 (DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Group 47 and 56; and DCA: MS XVIII, Article 9).

I went to Doctor barker att ye Charter Howse from thenc to ye fortune I dind with mr axel & gaue His wife for ned Laighton 20 s. I gaue His man 6 d. His mayd 6 d. so
I seald att vnderwoods ye fortune Leases & so came Home

div.ab: Alleyn was here arranging for the rebuilding of the Fortune after the fire that destroyed it the previous November; further entries follow. For the deeds relating to the rebuilding, see DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Groups 58–64.
Mr Smith was one of the Fortune tenants (William Young, The History of Dulwich College, part 1 (London, 1889), 99).

Mr Thicknis is unknown, but may have been a tenant in Golding Lane or White Cross Street. Sir John Dorrington had been Master of the Games, and Philip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn had exhibited bear-baiting at Paris Garden under his licence. He died in 1604, and his successor, Sir William Steward, then sold the office to Henslowe and Alleyn (DCA: MS II, Articles 3–6).

Thomas Dowton or Doughton, had been a player with the Admiral's and Prince Henry's men, and was now with Palantine's men; William Gawlter, Richard Gunnell, Anthony Jarman, Thomas Wigpitt, and William Cartwright were lessees of the Fortune (William Young, The History of Dulwich College, part 2 (London, 1889), 247).

Mr Axel was probably Robert Axel, a member of the Queen's company by 1631–3. Edward Laighton was one of Alleyn's servants. The leases sealed at Underwoods on 6 September 1622 were presumably those dated 20 May 1622, having been prepared earlier, and relate to the twelve shares leased to a number of persons, several of them members of the company (DCA: Muniments, Series 1, Groups 58–64 and DCA: MS C, Articles 7–13 and 15–16.)

head.title: Prynne, Histriomastix

body.head: sig Ggg*4 (God's judgement on Players and Play-haunters)

div.ab: Not to relate the various tragicall ends of many, who in my remembrance at London, have beene slaine in Play-houses, or upon quarrels there commenced: Nor yet to recite the sudden feareful burning even to the ground, both of the Globe and Fortune Play-houses, no man perceiving how these fires came: together with the visible apparition of the Devill on the Stage at the Belsavage Play-house, in Queene Elizabeths dayes, (to the great amazement both of the Actors and Spectators) whiles they were there prophanely playing the History of Faustus (the truth of which I have heard from many now alive, who well remember it,) there being some distracted with that feareful sight; I shall confine my selfe onely to such printed examples of Gods judgements upon many Players and Play-haunters together, which I find scattered here and there in sundry Authors.

head.title: Privy Council Letter to Sir Cuthbert Buckle, Lord Mayor

div.ab: After our very hartie commendations to your Lordship Whearas certein infourmation is given that very great multitudes of all sorts of people do daylie frequent & resort to common playes lately again set vp in & about London. whearby it is vpon good cause feared that the dangerous infection of the plague , by Gods great mercy and goodnes well slaked, may again very dangerously encrease and break foorth to the great losse and preiudice of hir Maiestes Subiects in generall & especially to those of that Citie of whose safetie & well doing hir Highnes hath alwayes had an especiall regard as by the last ʌyears experience by lyke occasions & resort to playes it soddainly encreased from a very little number to that greatnes of mortallitie which ensued. Wee thearfore thought it very expedient to require your Lordship foorthwith to take strait order that thear bee no more publique playes or enterludes exercised by any Companie whatsoever within the compas of five miles distance from London till vpon better lykelyhood and assurance of health farther direction may bee given from vs to the contrary. So wee bid your Lordship very hartily farewell. ffrom the Court at Hampton. the 3. of February.1593.
Your Lordships very loving friend.

Iohn Cantuar Io Puckering. C Howard
Thomas Buckhurst Robert Cecyll. I Fortescue

To our very good Lord mr Alderman Buckle
Lord Maior of the Citie of London.

head.title: Affidavit of Thomas Mowseherst in Alleyn v. Henslowe

body.head: f [147v] (5 February) ( Affadavit of Thomas Mouseherst in Alleyn v. Henslowe)

div.ab: Towchyng the cause at the sute of Edward Allen esquire plaintiff against William Henslowe defendant Thomas Mowseherst of Mareffeild in the county of Sussex yeoman aged lvj yeares or theareaboutes maketh othe, that the sayd defendant William Henslowe is an aged man about the age of three score and eight yeares, and hath been sick ever sithence the feast of St Batholomewe last past & seavenight before untill this present tyme, & yett is very sick & weake & keepeth his bed not able to helpe himself, And that the said defendant by reason of his long sicknes is become Deafe, & his sences & vnderstanding so decayed that he cannot well heare, nor understand the said complainantes bill (being read vnto him) to make answer therevnto.

head.title: Middleton and Dekker, The Roaring Girle

div.ab:
Alexander No more of thankes, no more, I mary Sir,
Th'inner roome was too close, how do you like
This Parlour Gentlemen?
Omnes Oh passing well.
Adam What a sweet breath the aire casts heere, so coole,
Goshawke I like the prospect best.
Laxton See how tis furnisht.
Sir Dapper A very faire sweete roome.

Alexander Sir Dauy Dapper,
The furniture that doth adorne this roome,
Cost many a faire gray groat ere it came here,
But good things are most cheape, when th'are most deere,
Nay when you look into my galleries,
How brauely they are trim'd vp, you all shall sweare
Yare highly pleasd to see whats set downe there:
Stories of men and women (mixt together
Faire ones with foule, like sun-shine in wet wether)
Within one square a thousand heads are laid
So close, that all of heads, the roome seeemesseemes seeemes: for seemes made,
As many faces there (fiil'dfill'd fiil'd: for fill'd with blith lookes)
Shew like the promising titles of new bookes,
(Writ merily) the Readers being their owne eyes,
Which seeme to moue and to giue plaudities,
And here and there (whilst with obsequious eares,
Throng'd heapes do listen) a cut purse thrusts and leeres
With haukes eyes for his prey: I need not shew him,
By a hanging villanous looke, your selues may know him,
The face is drawne so rarely, That sir below,
The very flowre (as twere) waues to and fro,
And like a floating Iland, seemes to moue,
Vpon a sea bound in with shores aboue,

head.title: Contract by Peter Streete between Philip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn

div.ab:
This
indenture made This indenture made: in display script the Eighte daie of Januarye 1599 1599: underlined And in the Two and ffortyth yeare of the Reigne of our sovereigne Ladie Elizabeth by the grace of god Quene of England ffraunce and Irelande defender of the ffaythe &c Betwene Phillipp Henslowe and Edward Allen of the parishe of Ste Saviour in Southwark in the Countie of Surrey gentlemen on thone parte and Peter Streete Citizen and Carpenter of London on theother parte. WitnessethWitnesseth: in display script That whereas the saide Phillipp Henslowe & Edward Allen the daie of the date hereof have bargayned compounded & agreed with the saide Peter Streete ffor the erecting building & settinge upp of a newe howse and Stadge. for a Plaiehowse in and upon a certeine plot or parcell of grounde appoynted oute for that purpose Scytuate and beinge nere Goldinge Lane in the parishe of Ste Giles withoute Cripplegate of London To be by him the said Peter Streete or some other sufficient woorkmen of his providinge and appoyntemente and ʌatt his proper Costis & Chardgis for the consideration hereafter in theis presentes expressed/ Made erected, builded and sett upp In manner & forme following (that is to saie) The frame of the saide howse to be sett square and to conteine ffowerscore foote of lawfull assize everye waie square withoute, and fiftie fiue foote of like assize square everye waie within, with a good suer and stronge foundacion of pyles brick lyme and sand, bothe without & within, to be wroughte one foote of assize att the leiste aboue the grounde. And the saide fframe to conteine Three Stories in heigyth. The first or Lower Storie to Conteyne Twelve foote of Lawfull assize in heighth. The second Storie Eleaven foote of lawfull assize in heigth. And the Third or vpper Storie to conteyne Nyne foote of lawfull assize in height/ All which All which: in display script Stories shall conteine Twelve foote and a halfe of lawfull assize in breadth througheoute besides a Juttey forwardes in eyther of the saide Twoe upper Stories of Tenne ynches of lawfull assize. With ffower convenient divisions for gentlemens roomes and other sufficient and convenient divisions for Twoe pennie roomes with necessarie Seates to be placed and sett Aswell in those roomes as througheoute all the rest of the galleries of the saide howse and with suchelike steares Conveyances & divisions withoute & within as are made & Contryved in and to the late erected Plaiehowse On the Banck in the saide parishe of Ste Saviours Called the Globe With a Stadge and Tyreinge howse to be made erected & settup within the saide fframe, with a shadowe or cover over the saide Stadge, which Stadge shalbe placed & sett As alsoe the stearcases of the saide fframe in suche sorte as is prefigured in a Plott thereof drawen. And which Stadge shall conteine in length ffortie and Three foote of lawfull assize and in breadth to extende to the middle of the yarde of the saide howse. The same Stadge to be paled in belowe with good stronge and sufficyent newe oken bourdes And likewise the lower Storie of the saide fframe with inside, and the same lower storie to be alsoe laide over and fenced with stronge yron pykes. And the saide Stadge to be in all other proporcions Contryved and fashioned Like unto the Stadge of the saide Plaiehowse Called the Globe, With convenient Windowes and lightes glazed to the saide Tyreinge howse And the saide fframe Stadge and Stearecases to be covered with Tyle and to haue a sufficient gutter of Lead to Carrie & convey the water frome the Coveringe of the saide Stadge to fall backwardes And also all the saide fframe and the Stairecases thereof to be sufficyently enclosed withoute with lathe lyme & haire and the gentlemens roomes and Twoe pennie roomes to be seeled with Lathe Lyme & haire and all the fflowers of the saide Galleries Stories and Stadge to be bourded with good & sufficyent newe deale bourdes of the whole thicknes wheare need shalbe. And And: in display script the saide howse and other thinges beforemencioed to be made & doen To be in all other Contrivitions Conveyances fashions thinge and thinges effected finished and doen accordinge to the manner and fashion of the saide howse Called the Globe Saveinge only that all the princypall and maine postes of the saide fframe and Stadge forwarde shalbe square and wroughte palasterwise with carved proporcions Called Satiers to be placed & sett on the Topp of every of the same postes. and saveing alsoe that the said Peter Streete shall not be charged with anie manner of Pay Pay: 20mm of text faded in or aboute the saide frame howse or Stadge or anie parte thereof nor Renderinge the walls within Nor seelinge anie more or other roomes then the gentlemens roomes Twoo pennie roomes and Stadge before remembred Nowe theiruppon Nowe theiruppon: in display script the saide Peter Streete dothe covenante promise and graunte ffor himself his executours and administratours to and with the saide Phillipp Henslowe and Edwarde Allen and either of them and the executours and administratours of them and either of them by theis presentes In manner & forme followeinge that is to saie That he the saide Peter Streete his executours or assignes shall and will att his or their owne proper costes & Chardges Well workmanlike &substancyallie make erect sett upp and fully finshe in and by all thinges accordinge to the true meaninge of theis presentes withe good stronge and substancyall newe Tymber and other necessarie stuff all the said fframe and other workes whatsoever In and vppon the saide plott or parcell of grounde (beinge not by anie auethoretie Restrayned and haveinge ingres egres and regres to doe the same) before the ffyve & Twentyth daie of Julie next Comeinge after the date hereof And shall alsoe And shall alsoe: in display script att his or theire like costes and Chardges Provide and finde all manner of workemen Tymber Ioystes Raftres bordes dores boltes hinges brick Tyle lathe lyme haire sande nailes
lae de laede: d written over another letter Iron Glass workmanshipp and other thinges whatsoever which shalbe needefull Convenyent & necessarie for the saide fframe & workes & euerie parte thereof And And: in display script shall alsoe make all the saide fframe in every poynte for Scantlinges lardger and bigger in assize Then the Scantlinges of the Timber of the saide newe erected howse Called the Globe. And alsoAnd also: in display script that he the saide Peter Streete shall furthwith aswell by himself As by suche other and soe manie Workmen as shalbe Convenient & necessarie enter into and vppon the saide buildinges and workes And shall in reasonable manner procede therein withoute anie wilfull detraccion vntil the same shalbe fully effected and finished In consideracion In consideracion: in display script of all which buildinges and of all stuff & woorkemanshipp thereto belonging the saide Phillipp Henslowe & Edward Allen and either of them forr themselves theire and either of theire executores and administratores doe ioyntlie & severallie Covenante & graunte to & with the saide Peter Streete his executores and administratores by theis presentes That they the saide Phillipp Henslowe & Edward Allen or one of them Or the executores and administratores or assignes of them or one of them shall & will well & trulie paie or Cawse to be paide vnto the saide Peter Streete his executores or assignes Att the place aforesaid appointed for the erectinge of the saide fframe The full some of ffower hundred & ffortie Poundes of lawfull money of Englande in manner and fforme followinge that is to saie, att suche tyme and whenas the Tymber woork of the saide fframe shalbe raysed & sett upp by the saide Peter Streete his executores or assignes or within Seaven daies then next followinge Twoe hundred & twentie poundes And att suche time and when as the saide fframe woorkes shalbe fullie effected & ffynished as is aforesaide Or within Seaven daies then next following thither Twoe hundred and Twentie poundes without fraude or Coven. Provided allwaiesProuided allwaies: in display script and it is agreed betwene the saide parties That whatsoever somme or sommes of money the saide Phillip Henslowe or Edward Allen or either of them or the executores or assignes of them or either of them shall lend or deliver vnto the saide Peter Streete his executores or assignes or anie other by his appointment or consent forr or concerning the saide woorkes or anie parte therof or anie stuff thereto belonginge before the raiseinge and setting upp of the saide fframe , shalbe reputed, accepted taken & accoumpted in the parte of the firste paymente aforesaid of the saide somme of ffower hundred & ffortie pounds And all soche somme & sommes of money as they or anie of them, shall as aforesaid lend or deliver betwene the razinge of the saide frame and finishing thereof and of all the rest of the saide woorkes. Shall be reputed accepted taken and accoumpted in parte of the last payment aforesaid of the same some of ffower hundred & ffortie poundes Anie thinge abouesaid to the contrary notwithstandinge/ In witness whereof In witness whereof: in display script the parties abovesaid to theis present Indentures Interchangeably haue sett there handes and seales yeoven the daie and yere ffirst abouewritten

Sealed and deliuered by the saide Peter Streete
in the persone of Mr William Harris Public scrivener
And mr Frauncis Smyth apprentice to the saide Scrivener

head.title: Assignment by Patrick Brewe to Edward Alleyn of the Lease from Daniel Gill

div.ab: To all Christian people To…people: in display script to whome this presente writing shall Come Pattrick Brewe Citizen and goldsmith of London sendeth greeting in our Lord God Euerlasting whereas whereas: in display script Daniell Gill thelder of the Isle of Manne yeoman by one Indenture of lease bearing date the Eleaventh day of Iuly in the Six and twentith yeare of the Raigne of the Queenes Maiesty that now is made betweene the said Dannell Gill of the one party And the said Pattrick Brew on the other party for the Consideracion therin mencioned hath hath: in display script demised graunted betaken and to farme letten vnto the said Pattrick Brew his executors administrators and assignes all those his Sixe Messuages or Tenementes with all and singuler shopps Cellers Chambers halls parlors, Romethes gardens voydgroundes lightes easementes watercourses wells Pathes wayes Entries outgates proffites Commodities and appurtenaunces whatsoever to the same six messuages or tenementes or any of them belonging or in any wise apperteyning late in the occupacion of one William Gill late of the parish of Sainte Giles without Criplegate of London Gardyner deceased or his assignes ffive of which said premisses are scituate and being on theste side of Goldinglane and theother messuage or tenemente on the west side of White Crosse streete in the said parrish of Sainte Giles without Criplegate in the County of Midlesex To haue and to houlde To…houlde: in display script all the said Messuages or tenementes with their appurtenaunces with all halls parlors kitchens Chambers Cellers sollers orchardes Gardens backsides voydgroundes lightes proffites easementes Comodities and advanntages whatsoeuer to them and every or any of them belonging or appertayning with free ingresse egresse and regresse into and from them and euery of them and all and every other the premisses with their appurtenaunces vnto the said Pattrick Brewe his executors admistrators and assignes from the feast of Sainte Michaell the Archangell nexte ensewinge the date of the same Indenture of lease for by and during the tearme of fforty and one yeares from thence nexte and ymediately ensewing and fully to be compleate ended and determyned Yealding and paying Yealding and paying: in display script therfore yearly during the said tearme vnto the said Daniell Gill his heires or assignes the somme of twelve poundes of lawfull monny of Englande uppon the ffeaste day of the appostells Phillip and Iacob or within fforty dayes the said ffeaste nexte ensewing being lawfully demaunded, as by the same Indenture of lease more at large it doth and may appeare Whereuppon Whereuppon: in display script know ye nowe that I the said Pattrick Brewe for and in consideracon of a certen some of good and lawfull monny of Englande to me in hande at thensealing and delyuerie hereof by Edward Allen of the parish of Sainte Savyors in Southwarke in the county of Surrey gentilman well and truly paid wherof and wherewith I the said Pattrick Brewe doe by theis presentes acknowledge and Confesse my self to be satisfied and thereof and of every parte and parcell thereof doe Cleirly acquite release and dischardge the said Edward Allen his heires executors administrators and every of them forever by theis presentes Have bargayned and sould aliened assigned and settouer and by theis presentes doe bargayne and sell alyen assigne and settouer vnto the said Edward Allen aswell the said verited Indenture of lease as also all and singuler suche state righte title interest possession demaunde and tearme of yeares as I the said Pattrick Brewe or any other to or for my vse haue hath shoulde mighte or of righte oughte to haue of in or to the said six messuages or tenements and other the premisses with thappurtenaunces demised by the said verited Indenture of lease or of in or to any parte or parcell thereof by force and vertue of the said Indenture of lease Together with all and singuler the Rentes and Reuersions reserued vppon such meane Leases as are hereafter in theis presentes mencioned to be excepted To haue and to houlde To…houlde: in display script all the said estate righte title interest possession demaunde and tearme of yeares which I the said Pattrick Brewe haue shoulde mighte or of righte oughte to haue now to come of in and to the said six houses or tenementes and other the premisses demysed by the said Indenture of lease together with the said Indenture of lease and all the Rents and reversions aforesaid reserued vppon the said meane leases vnto the said Edward Allen his executors administrators and assignes from day of the the date hereof vnto thend and full accomplishemente of all such and somany yeares as are now to Come and unexpired of the said tearme of fforty and one yeares mencioned in the said verited Indenture of lease And And: in display script I said the Pattrick Brewe for me my executors and administrators and for euery of vs doe Covenaunte and graunte to and with the said Edwarde Allen his executors and administrators and to and with every of them by theis presentes in manner and fourme following (that is to saie) That the said Indenture of lease and premisses therein conteyned and all and singuler other the premisses with thappurtenaunces by theis presentes mencioned to be bargayned and soulde and euery parte and parcell thereof the day of the date hereof are and so at all tymes hereafter during the residue yet to come of the said tearme of fforty and one yeares shalbe and Continue Cleir and Cleirly acquited exonerated or otherwise dischardged and saved harmles by ʌme the said Pattrick Brewe my executors administrators or assignes of and from all and singuler former bargaynes sales guiftes grauntes leases fynes forfertures arrerages of rentes Cause and Causes of forferture and reentry and of also from all other Charges titles trobles and Incomberannces whatsoeuer had made Comitted done or suffered or to be had made Comitted done or suffered by me the said Pattrick Brewe or by any other person or persons for me or myne or one or any of our meanes assente orrasion or procuremente the said yeirly rente reserued in the said Indenture of lease and the Covenaunts graunts and agreementes in the same Indenture specyfied from hensforth on the party and behalf of the tennaunte or Lesse thereof to grow due to be paid perfourmed and kepte/ excepte and alwaies excepted one lease bearing date the Tenth day of Aprill 1592 in the ffower and thirtith yeare of the Queenes Maiesties raigne that now is made by me the said Pattrick Brewe to Richard Nicholas Cittizen and Clothworker of London of all that Teynter for broade Clothes Called the middle teynter standing and being vppon parcell of the premisses demised by the said verited Indenture and of one other little parcell of grounde lying on the West end of the said teynter for the tearme of thirteen yeares and three quarters of a yeare Commencing from the feast of Thannunciacon of our Lady Sainte Mary the virgin last past before the date of the same lease Also excepte one other lease bearing date the twentith day of September 1591 and in the Three and thirtith yeare of the Raigne of our said Soveraigne Lady Queene Elizabeth made by the said Pattrick Brewe to Peeter Peirson Cittizen and merchantaylor of London of one tyenter lately erected and bylded Called the lesser teynter standing vppon parcell of the premisses and of one other little plott of grounde Conteyning in length from east to west thirty and nyne yardes of asize and in breadth from North to south eighte foote of assize for the tearme of ffowerteene yeares and one quarter of a yeare Comensing from the feaste of Sainte Michaell the Archangell nexte ensewing the date of the same lease And also And also: in display script excepte one lease bearing date the two and twentith day of Iune 1598 and in the ffortith yeare of the Raigne of our said soveraigne Lady the Queenes Maiesty that now is made and graunted by the said Pattrick Brewe to Thomas Gybbs of London yeoman of all that Tenemente and a Certen plott or parcell of grownde sometime vsed for a garden late in the tenure or occupacion of Iohn Waynewrighte yeoman scituate and being in Goldinglane in the parish of Sainte Giles without Criplegate in the County of Middlesex for the tearme of Nyneteene yeares comencing from the feast of the Nativety of Sainte Iohn Baptist nexte ensewing the date of the same lease And And: in display script I the said Pattrick Brewe for me my executors and administrators and for every of us doe Covneaunte and graunte to and with the said Edward Alleyn his executors administrators and assignes and to and with every of them by theis presentes That he the said Edward Allen his executors administrators and assignes for the said yearly rente of twelve poundes from hensforth to be paid according to the said first verited Indenture of lease and vnder the Covenauntes grauntes and agreementes in the same expressed shall or may peaceably and quietly haue hould occupy possesse and enioy the said Sixe Messuages or tenementes and all other the premisses by the said furst verited Indenture of lease demised with thappurtenaunces without any lawfull lett troble suite molestacion or interruption of me the said Pattrick Brewe my executors administrators or assignes or of any other person or persons whatsoeuer lawfully Clayming in by or vnder me the said Pattrick Brewe or any of them or in our or their or any of our righte title or interest except before excepted for and during all such and somany yeares as now are to come and unexpired of the said tearme of fforty and one yeares In witness whereof In…whereof: in display script I the said Pattrick Brew herevnto haue sett my hand and seall yeouen the Two and Twentith day of November 1599 1599: underlined And in the Two and fortith yeare of the Raigne our Soveraigne Lady Elizabeth by the grace of god Queene of England ffraunce and Ireland defender of the faith &c&c: followed by a scribal knot

head.title: Assignment by Patrick Brewe to Edward Alleyn of the Lease from Daniel Gill

div.ab: Nouerint vniuersi per presentes me Pattricum brew Civem et Aurifabrum London teneri et firmiter obligari Edwardo Allen de parochia Sancti Savior in Southwark in Comitatu Surrey generoso in Ducentis et quinquaginta libris legalis monete Anglie soluendiseidem Edwardo Allen aut suo certo attornato executoribusvel assignatis suis ad quam quidem solucionem bene et fideliter faciendam Obligo me heredes executores et administatratores meos per presentes sigillo meo sigillate datum vicesimto secundo die decembris 1599 anno regni dominne nostre Elizabethe dei gracia Anglie ffrauncie et Hibernie Regine fidei defensoris &c Quadragesimo Secundo

list.item:
eidem
Notario Notario: io written over other letters publico Richard Matheu

div.ab: The condicion of this obligation is such that if the withinbounde Patrick Brewe his heires executors and administrators and every of them doe for his and their partes well and truly hould obserue perfourme fufil and keepe all and every the Covenaunts graunts articles and agreements which on his and their partes are or oughte to be houlden obserued perfourmed and kepte mencioned and Conteyned in a Certen Writing or Pole deed of Assignement of the date within written made from the said Patrick Brewe vnto the withinnamed Edward Allen that is to say in and by all thinges according to the true intente and meaning of the said Pole deede without fraude or guile in any manner of wise That then this obligacion to be void and of none effecte Or eels to remayne in full strength and vertue.
Marked as sealed and delivered in the presence of George Samwell, notary public, in his hand; signed also by Arthur Langworth, Bartholomew Gillam, servant to Samwell, and Richard Matthew

head.title: Lease from Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn to Thomas Downton

ab.note: 1608: underlined and written to the right of the upright of the large and highly elaborated T of This

div.ab: his Indenture made the This…the: in display script Day of 1608 1608: underlined And in the yeres of the raigne of our soueraigne Lord James by the grace of god kinge of England ffraunce and Ireland Defender of the ffayth &c the Sixte and of Scotland the Twoe & ffortith Betweene Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn of the parishe of St Saviors in Southwark in the countye of Surrey Esquiors on thone partye And Thomas Downton of the parishe of St Gyles without Criplegate London gentleman on thother partye Witnessethe Witnessethe: in display script That the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn/ for & in Consideracion of the somme of Twentye and Seaven powndes and Tenne shillinges of lawful monye of England to them in hand att or before thensealinge hereof by the saide Thomas Downton paide whereof and wherewith they the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn Doe acknowledge themselves well and truly Contented satisfied and by theis presentes have demised Leased and to farme letten and by theis presentes DothDoe Doth: for Doe demise Lease and to farme lett vnto the said Thomas Downton one Eight parte of a ffowerth of all such Clere gaines in monye as shall hereafter duringe the terme herevunder demised arise growe accrew or become dewe or properly belonge vnto the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn or either of them their or either of their executors or assignes for or by reason of any stage playing or other exercise Commoditye or vse whatsoever vsed or to be vsed or exercised within the playhowse of the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn Commonly called the ffortune scituate & beinge betweene Whitecrostreete and goldinge lane in the parishe of St Gyles without Criplegate London in the County of Middlesex and the said Eight parte of affowerth parte of all the said Clere gaynes properlye belonginge to the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn to be paide by the said Phillip Henslowe & Edward Alleyn or one of them their or one of their executors or assignes vnto the saide Thomas Downton or his assignes euery day that any play or other exercise shalbe acted or exercised in the play howse aforesaide vpon the sharinge of the monies gathered and gotten att euery of the same & exercises as heretofore hath byn vsed and accustomed To have and to houlde To…houlde: in display script and receave the saide Eight parte of a ffowerth parte of the said Clere gaines to be gotten by playinge or by any other exercise whatsoever and to be paid in manner and forme aforesaid vnto the said Thomas Downton his executors and assignes ffrom the ffeast of St Michaell Tharchaungell last past before the date hereof vnto thend & terme of Thirteene yeres from thence next ensuinge and fully to be Compleate & Ended in as full ʌlarge ample and beneficiall manner and forme to all intentes Construccions and purposes as they the saide Phillipp Henslowe and Edward Alleyn or either of them or the executors or assignes of them or either of them might should or ought to haue had held enioyed receaved and taken the same as aforesaid; yf this present Indenture had neuer byn had nor made Yealdinge Yealdinge: in display script and paying therefore yerely during the said terme vnto the said Phillipp Henslowe and Edward Alleyn their heires executors or assignes Att the said play howse called the ffortune Tenne shillinges of lawfull mony of England Att ffower ffeastes or Termes of the yere (that is to say) att the ffeastes of the birth of our Lord god Thannunciacon of our Lady the Nativitye of St John Baptist And St Michael Tharchaungell or within ffowerteene days next ensuinge euery of the same ffeaste Dayes by euen porcions And And: in display script the said Thomas Downton for him his executors and administrators Doth Covenaunte & graunte to & with the said Phillip Henslowe & Edward Alleyn and either of them their and either of their heires executors and assignes by theis presentes in maner & forme ffollowinge (That is to say) That the said Thomas Downton his executors administrators or assignes shall att his or their owne proper Costes and Charges beare pay and Dischardge One equall eight parte of a ffower parte of all such necessarye and needfull Charges as shalbe bestowed or layd forth in the new buildinge or repairinge of the said play howse duringe the said Terme of Thirteen yeres with fraud or Covyn And that And that: in display script he the said Thomas Downton shall not att anye tyme hereafter Duringe the saide terme giue over the facultye or qualitye of playinge but shall in his owne person exercise the same to the best and most benefitt he Cann within the play howse aforesaid Duringe the tyme aforesaid unles he shall become vnhable by reason of sicknes or any other infirmitye Or unles yt be with the Consent of the said Phillipp Henslowe and Edward Alleyn or either of them their executors or assignes And And: in display script that he the said Thomas Downton shall not att any tyme hereafter duringe the said terme of Thirteene yeres play or exercise the facultye of stage playinge in any Common play howse nowe erected or hereafter to be erected within the said cittye of London or Twoe Myles Compasse thereof other then in the said play howse Called the ffortune without the speciall licence will consent & agreement of the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn or one of them their or one of their heires executors or assignes first therefore and had & obteyned wrytinge vnder their handes and Seales And And: in display script that he the said Thomas Downton shall not att any tyme hereafter duringe the said Terme giue graunte bargayne sell or otherwise doe away or departe with the said Eight part of a ffowerth part of the said Clere gaines before demised nor any parcell thereof to any person or persons whatsoeuer without the like consent licence will & agreement of them the said Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn or either of them their or either of their heires executors administrators or assignes first therefore had & obteyned in wrytinge vnder their handes and seales for the same as aforesaid And the saideAnd the saide: in display script Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn for them & either of them their & either of their heires executors & administrators Doe Covenaunte and graunte to & with the said Thomas Downton his executors & assignes by theis presentes. That he the said Thomas Downton his executors & assignes paying the saide yerly Rent of Tenne shillinges in forme aforesaid and perorminge all other the Covenauntes grauntes articles & agreementes abouesaid on his & their partes to be perfomed shall or may during the said terme of Thirteene yeres have hould receave and enioye the said Eight parte of a ffowerth parte of all the said Clere gaines to be gotten by playinge or any other exercise as aforesaid in manner and forme aforesaide accordinge to the true intent & meaninge of theis presentes without the lett trouble molestacion deniall or interupcion of the Phillip Henslowe and Edward Alleyn & either of them theire or either of their heires or assignes Or of any other person or persons by their either or any of their meanes right title interest or procuremente Prouided Prouided: in display script alwais That if yt shall happen the said yerely Rent of Tenne shillinges or any parcell thereof to be behinde & unpaid in parte or in all by the said space of ffowerteene Dayes next over or after any ffeaste day of payment thereof abouesaid in which the same ought to be paide, beinge lawfully Demanded att the place aforesaid/ Or if the said Thomas Downton his executors & administrators or assignes or any of them doe infringe or breake any of the Covenauntes grauntes articles or agreementes abouesaid on his or their partes to be perfomed Contrary to the tenor & true meaning of theis presentes That then and from thenceforth this present lease Demise and graunte & euery Covenaunte graunte and article herein Conteyned on the parte & behalf of the saide Phillip & Edward or either of them their or either of their heires executors or assignes from henceforth to be perfomed shalbe vtterly voide frustrate & of none effect to all intentes Construccions & purposes any thinge herein Conteyned to the Contrarye thereof in any wise notwithstandinge In witnes In witnes: in display script whereof the said parties to theis present Indentures sunderly haue sett their handes and Seales yeouen the day and yeres first aboue written

head.title: Lease from Edward Alleyn to Edward Juby and Others

div.ab: This Indenture madeThis…made: in display script the last daie of October Anno domini 1618 1618: underlined And in the Sixteenth yeare of the raigne of our soveraigne Lorde Iames by the grace of god king of England ffraunce and Ireland defendor of the faith &c And of Scotland the Two and ffifteth Betweene Edward Alleyne of dulwich in the Countie of Surrey esquire of the one partie And Edward Jubye william Bird alias Bourne ffranck Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre and Richard ffowler Gentlemen of the other partie Witnesseth Witnesseth: in display script that the said Edward Alleyn for and in consideracion of the rentes herevnder reserved and for divers other good cavses and consideracions him especially moving, hath demised leased betaken and to farme letten, And by these presentes doth demise lease betake and to farme lett vnto the said Edward Jubye william Bird alias Bourne ffranck Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre & Richard ffowler , All that his great building now vsed for a playhowse and comonly called by the name of the ffortune scituate lying and being betweene whitecrosse street and golding lane in the Countie of Middlesex in the parish of St Giles without Creplegate London togither with all lightes waies passages easementes Commodities and appurrtenaunces to the same belonging or apperteyning or therewith now vsed occupied or enioyed, togither with one messuage or Tenemente therevnto adioyning called the Taphowse nowe in the occupacion of one Marke Brigham or his assignes; and also one peece of grownd as yt is now impaled conteyning in length east and west Cxxiij foote Cxxiij foote: added later by the same hand in a space left for that purpose of assize more or lesse & in breadth north & south seaventeene ffoote of assize more or lesse & rangeth with the passage on the south side of the said playhowse To haue To haue: in display script and to hould the said great building or playhowse called the ffortune aforesaid togither with the said messuage or Tenemente called the Taphowse & peece of grownd aforesaid with all and singuler the appurrtenaunces before demised (reserving notwithstanding & except such lease and estate as the said Edward Alleyn hath formerly made there of a little tenement & other lymitacions to one John Russell) vnto the said Edward Jubye william Bird alias Bourne ffranck Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre and Richard ffowler their executours and administratours and assignes from the feast of St Michaell the Archaungell Last past before the date hereof vnto the end and terme of Thirtie and one yeares from thence next ensewing and fully to be complete and ended yeilding yeilding: in display script and paying therefore yearely and euery yeare During the said terme of Thirtie and one yeares vnto the said Edward Alleyn and his assignes if the the said Edward Alleyn shall so long live the somme or yearely rent of Two hundred powndes of lawfull monie of England, At or in the now dwelling howse of the said Edward Alleyn scitutae in Duwich aforesaid, At fower vsuall feastes or termes in the yeare, that is to say, at the feastes of the birth of our Lord god the Annunciacon of the blessed Virgin Marie the nativitie of St John Baptist and St Michaell the Archangell by even porcions And also two rundlettes of wyne the one sack and the other Clarett of ten shillinges a peece price to be Deliuered at the feast of Christmas yearely at the place aforesaid And And: in display script if yt fortune the said Edward Alleyn to Dye before the expiracion of the said Thirtie and one yeares, Then yeilding and paying vnto the heires and assignes of the said Edward Alleyn for and during the rest and residue of the said terme of xxxjty yeares which at the tyme of such deceasse shalbe unexpired, at the place aforesaid every yeare yearely the somme or yearely rent of one hundred & Twentie powndes at the said fower vsuall feastes in the yeare by even porcions, The first payment thereof to begin at such of the feastes aforesaid which shall first happen next after such decease of the said Edward Alleyn . And And: in display script the said Edward Jubye william Bird alias Bourne ffranck Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre and Richard ffowler for themselves their executors administrators and assignes Doe covenaunt promise and graunt to and with the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes by these presentes, That they the said Edward Jubye william Bird alias Bourne ffranck Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre and Richard ffowler or some of them their executors administrators or assignes the said Building or playhowse, messuage called the Taphowse; & peece of grownd aforesaid & all buildinges & edfices vpon the said pece of grownd within the said terme to be erected in by and with all manner of needfull & necessarie reparacons whatsoever well and sufficiently shall repaire uphold susteyn fence maintaine & keepe and the pavementes waies and passages leading to the said playhowse shall well and sufficiently paue repaire & amend from tyme to tyme when & as often as need shall require during the said terme, And in the end of the said terme or other sooner determynacion of this presente lease the said demised premisses so well and sufficiently repayred upholden susteyned maynteyned kept paved & amended shall leaue surrender and yeld vp vnto the said Edward Alleyn his heires & assignes, And further that yt shall and may be lawfull to and for the said the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes with workmen and others at his and their wills and pleasures twice in euery yeare yearely or oftener during the said terme at convenient tymes to enter and come into the said plaiehowse and euery parte and parcell thereof there to view search and see thestate of the reparacions of the same with other the premisses hereby demised, And if any Default or want of reparacions then & there be (vpon any such view found) thereof to giue or leave notice or warning in wryting to or for the said Edward Iuby william Bird alias Burne ffrank Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre & Richard Fowler or to any of them to repaire & amend all & euery such Decayes Defaultes or wantes of reparacions within sixe monethes next ensewing such warning given And And: in display script further the said Edward Iubye william Bird alias Bourne ffrank Grace Richard Gumnell Charles Massie william Stratford william Cartwright Richard Price william Parre & Richard Fowler for them their executors administrators & assignes Doe covenaunt promise & graunt to and with the said Edward Alleyn his heires & assignes, that they nor any of them their executors admistrators or assignes shall not at any tyme hereafter alter transpose or otherwise Conuert the said playhowse to any other vse or vses then as the same is now vsed; and shall not lett sett alien assigne or sett ouer the Demised premisses or any parte thereof to any person or persons without the consent & agreement of the said Edward Alleyn his heires or assignes in wryting first had & obteyned in that behalf Prouided Prouided: in display script alwaies that if yt shall happen the said yerely rentes of Two hundred powndes and one hundred & twentie powndes to be behind & unpaid in parte or in all by the space of three weekes next after any feast or terme of payment thereof in which the same ought to be paid at the place aforesaid, or if the said Leassees aboue specified shall not well & truly observe fulfil & keepe all & singular the covenauntes clawses & agreementes aboue specified on his and their partes to be done & observed according to the plaine meaning of these presentes. That then at all tymes after yt shall and may be lawfull to & for the said Edward Alleyn his heires & assignes into all & singular the demised premisses with the appurtenaaunces wholly to renter and the same to haue againe retaine & repossessed as in his or their first estate Any thing in these presentes conteyned to the contrary notwithstanding AndAnd: in display script whereas the said Edward Alleyn by his Indenture of demise bearing Date the Twenteth Daie of June 1617. 1617: underlined hath let one smale tenemente conteyning twoo Roomes adioyning to the said playhowse to one John Russell aforesaid for the Terme of ffower score & nynteene yeares yf the said John so long shall live Comencing at the feast of St John baptist next ensewing the said Date thereof vnder the rent of xxiiij s. During the life of the said Edward Alleyn ; and iiij s. yearely after his Deceasse; as by the said Indenture amongst other thinges therein contyened yt may appeare at large Now the said Edward Alleyn doth covenaunt and agree for him his heires & assignes that the said Leassees aforesaid shall haue receave & take of the said John Russell & his assignes the said lease Rent reserved by the said lease as parte of this demise & that if the said John dye before the expiracion of the said xxxj yeares that then the said two rooms shalbe parte of this demise without any further rent therefore to be held vnder the covenauntes & reservacions aboue specified, And also that the said Leassees & euery of them their executors administrators & assignes for the yearely rentes aboue reserved & vnder the covenauntes condicions & agreementes herein aboue reserved on their partes to be done and observed shall or lawfully may peaceably and quietly haue hold occupie possesse and enioy the demised premisses and euerye parte thereof without any lawfull let trouble eviccion or interruption of the said Edward Alleyn his heires or assignes or of any other person or persons by his or their meanes right title Interest consent or procurement ʌDuring the said xxxi yeris In witnesIn witnes: in display script whereof the parties to these Indentures haue interchaungeably put their hands and seales, yeoven the daie and yeares first aboue written

head.title: Bargain and Sale by Daniel Gill and Others to Edward Alleyn

div.ab:
This Indenture made theThis…the: in display script Thirteth daye of Maye Anno Domini 1610 And in the Eighte yeare of the Raigne of our Soveraigne Lord Iames by the grace of God King of England ffraunce and Ireland defendor of the faith &c And in the Three and ffortith of his Raigne of Scotland, Betwene Daniell Gill thelder of the Isle of Man yeoman, and William Gill sonne and heire apparent of the saide Daniell and Edmund Gill seacond sonne of the same Daniell and William Clarke of the parishe of Iurbie within the Isle aforesaide yeoman, and Elizabeth his wife, one of the Daughters and Coheires of Daniell Gill the younger late of the Isle of Man aforesaide Clerke deceased, and the late naturall brother of the saide William and Edmund, and Phillipp Moore of the parishe of Kirke Lonan within the Isle of Man aforesaide yeoman, and Katheryn his wife one other of the daughters and Coheires of the saide Daniell Gill the younger, Donald Qualtrough of the parishe of Kirke Lonan aforesaide yeoman and Margarett his wife one other of the daughters and Coheires of the saide Daniell Gill the younger, and Hugh Cannell Clarke Vicar, of the the parishe Churche of Kirke Michaell within the saide Isle of Man and Iane his wife, one other of the daughters and Coheires of the saide Daniell Gill the younger on thone partie, And Edward Alleyn of the parishe of St Saviours in Southwarke in the Countie of Surrey Esquire on thother partie witnessethe// witnessethe: in display script That the saide Daniell Gill thelder, William Gill, Edmund Gill, William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife, Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife, Donald Qualtrough Margarett his wife, and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife, ffor and in Consideracon of the some of Three hundreth and ffortye powndes
powndes: followed by a blank space of 60mm with line fillers of lawfull money of England to them in hande payed att and before thensealinge hereof, by the saide Edward Alleyn whereof and wherewith they acknowledge and confesse themselves fully satisfied and paied, And thereof and of everie parte and parcell thereof doe clerlie acquite and dischardge the saide Edward Alleyn his heires executors and assignes and everie of them for ever by theis presentes, have given graunted bargained solde alyened enfeoffed and confimed, And by theis presentes doe fullie clerelie and absolutlie give graunte bargaine sell alyen enfeoffe and confirme vnto the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes for ever, All those their Twelve Tenementes be they more or lesse and all that their Playhouse comonlie called or knowen by the name of the ffortune or by what other name it be knowen or called with their and euery of their severall appertenaunces, scittuate and beinge in the parishe of St Giles without Creplegate London and in the Countie of Middlesex or in either of them nowe or later beinge in the severall tenures or occupacions of the saide Edward Alleyn, Iohn Bowman Silikeweaver, Thomas Clement Smith, William Garrett Copersmith, William Broxon Blackesmith. William Hudson Victualler, Henry Smith Cooke, Roger Iveson Clothworker, Henry ffoyce Cittizen and Salter of London, Roger Barfeild Gentleman, William Course Gentleman, Nicholas Bennett Porter, and Edmund Williams Packthred maker or their or some of their assignee or assignes, And alsoe all and singuler shopps Cellers sollers Chambers roomes yardes gardens backesides voyde groundes lightes easiamentes wells watercourses pathes wayes passages entries out gates proffittes Comodities hereditamentes and appurtenaunces whatsoever to the saide Twelve Tenementes and Playhouse and other the premisses or anye of them belonging or in any wise apperteyninge, or nowe or att anye tyme heretofore accepted reputed taken knowen demised leased vsed occupied enioyed or estemed as parte parcell or member of the same or of anye of them, Sixe of which saide Twelue Tenementes are scittuat and beinge on the East side of Goldinge Lane in the parishe and Countie aforesaide, and thother Sixe of the saide Twelue Tenementes are scittuat and beinge on the west side of white Crosse streete in the parishe and Countie aforesaide, All which saide Tenementes Playhouse and other the premisses abutt vpon white Crosse streete aforesaide on the East parte and vpon goldinge Lane aforesaide and the landes and Tenementes nowe or late of Thomas Langham ffishemounger nowe or late in the severall tenures of Garrett Arnolde and Richard Dodd on the west and North, that is to saye, parte on the west, and parte on the North, and vpon the landes and groundes nowe or late called the Rose and Crowne, nowe or late in the tenure or occuapcion of Iohn Hiller Goldsmith towardes the North, and the landes and Tenementes nowe or late of Richard Roper Baker, and Godfrey Isburd Haberdasher, and a peece of grounde apperteyninge to the Chamber of London towardes the south And the saideAnd the saide: in display script Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryne his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife ffor the Considerations aforesaide, have gyven graunted bargayned solde alyened enfeoffed and confimed And by theis presentes doe fullie clerelie and absolutlie give graunte bargaine sell alien enfeoffe and confirme vnto the saide Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes for ever All other their landes Tenementes Gardens, yardes and hereditamentes whatseoeuer with their appurtenaunces in the saide parishe of St Giles and Countie of Middlesex or in either of them other then those fower Messuages or Tenementes nowe or late beinge in the severall tenures or occupacions of Thomas Wood Iohn Meredith William Boyte and Barnaby Lowe By William Gill late of the parishe of Sainct Giles without Creplegate aforesaide Gardener deceased in and by his last will and testament to one Richard yaton given and bequeathed TogetherTogether: in display script with the revercion and revercions of all and singuler the premisses hereby bargayned and solde And alsoe all the state right title interest vse benefitt possession remaynder Clayme and demaund whatsoeuer of them the the saide Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife or of anye or either of them of in and to the premisses hereby bargayned and solde or mencioned ment or intended to be bargayned and solde and of in and to every or anye parte therof, Together with all and singuler the deedes evidences writinges Charters terrours fynes exemplificacons counterparte of Leases escriptes and Mynymentes touchinge or conceninge the premisses or anye parte or parcell thereof To haue holdeTo haue holde: in display script occupie and enioye all the saide Tenementes Playhouse yardes gardens backesides wayes passages and all other the premisses with Thappurtenaunces before and in theis presentes mencioned ment or intented to be hereby bargayned and solde and everie parte thereof vnto the the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes for ever, To thonelie proper vse and behoof of the saide Edward Alleyn and of his heires and assignes for ever, absolutelie without anye manner of Condicion or incombraunce and without lymittacion of anye other vse or vses, And the saideAnd the saide: in display script Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke Phillipp Moore Donald Qualtrough and Hugh Cannell for them and the saide Elizabeth Katheryn Margarett and Iane their wyves and for everie of them their and everie of their heires executors and administrators doe Covenaunte promise and graunte, To and with the saide Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes and to and with everie of them by theis presentes, in manner and forme followinge, that is to saie That they the the saide Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife nowe are or some or one of them is verie true lawfull and rightfull Owner or Owners in fee simple of all and singuler the saide Tenementes Playhouse yardes gardens backesides wayes and of all singuler other the before mencioned premisses with their appurtenaunces and of everie parte and parcell therof And that And that: in display script they the saide Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife nowe are, or some or one of them is thereof lawfullie seyzed of a good sure perfect lawfull righte full and indefesible estate of inheritanunce in fee simple absolutlie without anye Condicion or other lymittacion reuercion or remaunder in anye other person or persons And the saide And the saide: in display script Daniell Gill thelder, William, Edmund, William, Elizabeth, Phillipp, Katheryn, Donald, Margarett and Hugh and Iane nowe have or some or one of them nowe hath full power good righte iust and true title strengtht and lawfull authoritie in fee simple to gyve graunte bargaine sell alyen enfeoffe and confirme, all the saide Twelve Tenementes Playhouse yardes gardens backesides and all other the premisses above mencioned and everie parte and parcell thereof vnto the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes forever in manner and forme aforesaide and accordinge to the true meaning of theis presentes, And thatAnd that: in display script all and singuler the saide Tenementes Playhouse yardes gardens backesides and all other the premisses with their appurtenaunces herein or hereby mencioned ment or intended to be bargayned and solde and everie parte and parcell thereof nowe are and be and soe from henceforth and att all times foever hereafter shall Continue remayne and be vnto the saide Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes free clere and clerlie dischardged or by the saide Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife their heires executors or administrators shalbe sufficientlie saved and kepte harmeles, Of and from all and all manner of former and other bargaines sales guiftes grauntes Leases Recognizaunces bondes yssues fynes amerciamentes vses wills entayles dowers thirdes mortgages estates conveyanunces Iudgementes execucions extentes Annuyties Rente Chardge Rent seckescot, secke: for scot(?) And all other titles troubles Chardges and Incombrances whatsoeuer hadd made comitted caused procured donne suffered or knowledged or att anye time or times hereafter to be had made comitted caused donne suffered or knowledged by the saide Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife or anye of them or by their or anye of their heires or assignes or by one William Gill of the parishe of Sainct Giles Creplegate without Creplegate aforesaide Gardener nowe deceased, Or by anye other person or persons The Rent and services from henceforth to become due to the Cheif Lord or Lordes of the fee or ffees of the premisses for or in respecte of his or their seignorie or seignories excepte and foreprised, And alsoe excepte of suche personne or personnes as shall clayme by vertue of one Lease bearinge date the Eleaventh daye of Iulie, in the sixe and and Twentith yeare of the Raigne our late soveraigne Ladye Queene Elizabeth made of the saide premissses by the saide Daniell Gill thelder vnto one Patrick Brewe Cittizen and Goldsmith of London ffor the terme of ffortie and one yeares from the ffeast daye of Sainct Michaell the Archaungell next ensuinge the date of the saide Lease, Wherevpon the yearlie Rent of Twelue Poundes is reserved and shall continue duringe the said terme. And alsoe excepte of such person or persons as shall clayme by vertue of one other Lease bearinge date the last daye of Iune. Anno Domini 1601 And in the Three and ffortith yeare of the raigne of our saide late soveraigne Ladye Queene Elizabeth made of the saide premisses by the saide Daniell Gill thelder, William Gill and Edmund Gill vnto Iohn Garrett Cittizen and Clothworker of London ffor the terme of Twentie and One yeares ymediately from and after thend expiracion forfeyture surrender or other determinacion of the saide firste mencioned Lease bearinge date the Eleaventh daye of Iulie aforesaid wherevpon the yearlie rent of Twelue Poundes is reserved duringe the said terme, And which said twoe severall yearlie Rentes of Twelue Poundes and Twelue Poundes shalbe and continue due and payeable vnto the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes during all the residue of the saide twoe severall termes of ffortie and One yeares and Twentie and One yeares nowe to come and vnexpired And further And further: in display script that he the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes shall and lawfullie maie peaceablie and quietlie from henceforth forever have holde vse occupie possesse and enioye all the saide Tenementes Playhouse yardes Gardens backesides wayes passages and all and singuler other the premisses with their appurtenaunces by theis presentes bargained and solde or mencioned ment or intended to be hereby bargained and solde and everie parte and parcell thereof, And the rentes yssues proffittes and revenewes thereof from henceforth comynge shall or maie receive take and enioye to his and their owne proper vse and behoof for ever without any lett trouble expulcion disturbance Clayme eviccion or interrupcion of the said Daniell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife or anye of them or anye of their heires or assignees or anye of them or of anye other person or persons whatsoeuer other then of suche person or persons sonelie as shall Clayme to holde the premisses by vertue of the said twoe severall Leases before excepted And the saide And the saide: in display script Danyell Gill thelder William Gill Edmund Gill William Clarke Phillipp Moore Donald Qualtrough and Hugh Cannell for them and the saide Elizabeth Katheryn Margarett and Iane their wyves and for everie of them their and everie of their heires executors and administrators and for everie of them doe further Covenante promise and graunte, To and with the saide Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes and to and with everie of them by theis presentes, That they the saide Daniell Gill thelder and Katheryn his wife William Gill and Isabel his wife Edmund Gill and Katheryn his wife William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donald Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and Hugh Cannell and Iane his wife and their heires and all and everie other persone and personnes whatsoever and their heires anye righte title or interest vse possession revercion remaunder or demaund havinge clayminge or pretendinge to have to of or in the said twelue Tenementes Playhouse yardes gardens backsides and all other the aboue mencioned premisses with Thappurtenaunces or of or in or to anye parte or parcell thereof Other then the Chief Lord or Lordes of the fee or fees thereof and suche onelie as shall clayme to holde the saide premisses by vertue of the said twoe severall Leases above excepted att all and everie tyme and tymes hereafter when and as often as he or they or anye of them shall therevnto required shall cause knowledge execute procure and suffer to be donne knowledged and executed all and everie suche further lawfull arte and artes thinge and thinges devise and devises conveyaunce and assuraunce assueraunce suertie suer makinge and conveyinge of all and singular the saide Tenementes Playhouse yardes gardens and all other the premisses above mencioned to be bargained and solde with Thappurtenaunces to be had made assured and conveyed to the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes to the sole and onelie vse and behoof of him the said Edward Alleyn his heires and assignes absolutely for ever Be it by deed or deedes inrolled or not inrolled with thinrollement of theis presentes fyne or fynes ffeoffament recovery or recoveries release confirmacion or otherwise with warrantie against all men or without warrantie All which assuraunce soe to be had and made shalbe at thonlie coste and Chardges in Lawe of the said Edward Alleyn his heires or assignes They the said Daniel Gill thelder and Katheryn his wife William Gill and Isabel his wife Edmund Gill and Katheryn his wife William Clarke and Elizabeth his wife Phillipp Moore and Katheryn his wife Donlad Qualtrough and Margarett his wife and hugh Cannell and Iane his wife not to be compelled to travell further for the makinge of the same further assurance or assuraunces then the saide Isle of Man And yt is And yt is: in display script further Covenaunted graunted concluded and agreed betwene all the said parties to theis presentes for them their heires and assignes That all and everie the same Arte and Artes devise and devises conveyaunces and assuraunces hereafter by vertue of theis presentes to be had made donne excuted and knowledged for and concerninge the better assuringe and conveyinge of the said bargayned premisses and all and everie ffyne and ffynes Recoverie and Recoveries there vpon or concerninge the said bargained premisses to be levied had knowledged passed or suffered by what name or names soever shalbe to thonelie sole and proper vse and behoof of the saide Edward Alleyn and of his heires and assignes for ever and to none other vse intent and purpose In witnes In witnes: in display script whereof the parties first above named to theis present Indentures interchaungeablie have sett their handes and seales yeoven the daye and yeare first above written/

head.title: Assignment by Agnes Henslowe to Gregory Franklin and John Hammond of Leases from Edward Alleyn to Philip Henslowe

div.ab:
This IndentureThis Indenture : in display script with large elaborated initial T made the fifteenth daye of ffebruarie in the yeares of the Raigne of our soueraigne Lord Iames by the grace of God of England ffraunce and Ireland Kinge defender of the ffaithe &c the Thirteenth and of Scotlande the Nyne and ffortith Betweene Betweene: in display script Agnes Henslowe widdowe Executrixe and late wife of Phillip Henslowe late of the parish of St SaviousSaviours Savious: for Saviours ʌwithin the Borrough of Southwark in the Countie of Surrey Esquire deceased of the one parte. And Gregorie ffrancklyn Cittizen and Sadler & Drewe Stapley Cittizen & Grocer of London. And Iohn Hamond Cittizen and Merchantayler of London of the other parte. witnesseth witnesseth: in display script That whereas Edward Alleyn Esquire by the name of Edward Alleyn of the parish of St Saviours in the Countie of Surreye gentleman in and by one Indenture bearinge date the ffowerth daye of Aprill in the three and ffortith yeare of the Raigne of our late soueraigne Ladie Queene Elizabeth for the Consideracion therein mentioned did demise graunte and to ffearme lett vnto the saide Phillip Henslowe the moyetie or one half of a playhouse and of a certayne plott of ground wherevpon the said Playhouse was builte and of all the necesaries and appurtenaunces thereof within the compasse of the saide Plott, and the moyetie or one half of all such other growndes adioyninge to the said house as then were inclosed to be belonginge to the said house on the North and West side thereof. And the moyetie or one half ʌof parcell of the plott of ground on the South side of the said house extendinge from the outmost boundes thereof at the West Eastward thirtie ffoote of assize. And from the uttermost boundes thereof on the South towards the North ffowerteene ffoote of Assize with a competent waye the Breadth of a Carte waye at the least on the south side aforesaid of the said house from one doore of the said house to an other to be vsed in Common by and betweene the said parties theire executors & assignes with free ingresse egresse and regresse into and from the said house by the waye and wayes therevnto nowe vsed and accustomed. In so large & ample manner & forme as the said Edward Alleyn then had or enioyed the same waye and wayes. And also the moyetie or one half of all the gaynes comoditie some and somes of money and proffittes whatsoever which from tyme to tyme should cleerlie come arise and be gotten in or by the use and occupacion of the said Playhouse with the appurtenaunces either by reason of playinge there or otherwise howsoever by the graunt demise vsinge or lettinge of the said Edward Alleyn and Phillip Henslowe theire executors or assignes or any of them after the date of the saide Indenture . The allowance and parte of the company which for the tyme beinge shall playe there which shall be allowed to them by the ioynte consente & agreement of both the said parties theire executors & assignes excepted. And one house then newlie erected and builded by the said Edward Alleyn at his owne proper charges then adioyinge and fixed to the Southside of the said playhouse . And all and singular the estate right title & interest vse possession revercion & revercions clayme and demaund whatsoever which he the said Iames Russell or any other person or persons to his use or behoof then hadd might should or ought to haue to of and in the said last mencioned Indenture of lease and the said messauage or Tenement with the appurtenaunces and other the premisses in and by the said last mencioned Indenture mencioned to be assigned and conveyed by any wayes or meanes howsoever To be had To be had: in display script and holden to the said Phillipp Henslowe his executors & assignes from the daye of the date of the said Indenture forthwards for and duringe all the rest and residue then to come & vnexpired of the said Terme of thirtie and fower yeares and three quarters of one yeare in the said last mencioned Indenture expressed to be graunted in as large ample and beneficiall manner and forme in everie thing to all intentes & constructions as the said Iames Russell his executors or administrators might should or ought to haue had held & enioyed the same yf the said last mencioned Indenture had never beene had or made. All that Messuage or Tenement then commonlie called or knowne by the name or signe of the Iames otherwise called the ffooles head somtymes beinge two Messuages or Tenements with all and singular shoppes sellars Sollars Chambers Roomes lightes wharffes easmentes yardes backsides comodities and appurtenauces thervnto belonginge or in any wise apperteyninge then in the tenure or occupacion of Nicholas Ridgwaye or of his assignee or assignes scituate and beinge in the libertie of the Clinck with in the said Parish of St Saviours in Southwark aforesaid in the said Countie of Surreyand the same messuage and last mencioned premisses with the apputennces the said Leonard Bilson then helde with and amongst divers other thinges by the lease and Demise of the Reverend ffather in God Thomas then and yett Bisshoppe of Winchester for divers yeares then enduringe To be hadTo be had: in display script and holden to the said Phillip Henslowe his executors administrators and assignes from the feast of St Michaell the Archangell then last past before the date of the said last mencioned Indenture vnto the end and Tearme of Twentie yeares from thence nexte ensuyinge and fullie to be compleate and ended vnder the yearlie Rente of ffower pounds of lawfull money of England therby reserved to be paid to the said Leonard Bilson his executors and assignes during the said Terme of Twentie yeares at the ffeastes of the Nativitie of our Lord God the Annunciacon of the blessed Virginie St Marie the Nativitie of St Iohn Baptist and St Michaell the Archangell by even and equall porcions.
